quote: Words are like eggs dropped from great heights; you can no more call them back than ignore the mess they leave when they fall.
author: Jodi Picoult,  Salem Falls

quote: I never met a word I didn't love
author: Gail Carson Levine

quote: It takes writing a billion bad words before you get to the good ones.
author: Ray Bradbury

quote: What's another word for thesaurus?
author: Steven Wright

quote: I have hated words and I have loved them, and I hope I have made them right.
author: Markus Zusak,  The Book Thief

quote: A word is not the same with one writer as it is with another. One tears it from his guts. The other pulls it out of his overcoat pocket.
author: Charles Péguy,  Basic Verities, Prose, and Poetry

quote: And what is wrong with playing with words? Words love to be played with, just like children or kittens do!
author: David Almond,  My Name Is Mina

quote: Who needs a large vocabulary when you can just make up any word at any time? It makes life a whole lot more emeaglibop.
author: Jarod Kintz,  How to construct a coffin with six karate chops

quote: A Word is DeadA word is deadWhen it is said,Some say.I say it justBegins to liveThat day.
author: Emily Dickinson,  The Complete Poems

quote: Cheapen words and they'll cheapen you
author: Benny Bellamacina

quote: This book was written using 100% recycled words.
author: Terry Pratchett,  Wyrd Sisters

quote: There are no bad words. Bad thoughts. Bad intentions, and wooooords.
author: George Carlin

quote: Any word you have to hunt for in a thesaurus is the wrong word. There are no exceptions to this rule.
author: Stephen King

quote: It is a damn poor mind that can think of only one way to spell a word.
author: Andrew Jackson

quote: Kind words change the world.
author: A.D. Posey

quote: One word can change your life forever.I love youI hate youThink about it
author: Alan Macmillan Orr,  The Natural Mind - Waking Up: Volume I

quote: Wordplay hides a key to reality that the dictionary tries in vain to lock inside every free word.
author: Julio Cortázar,  Around the Day in Eighty Worlds

quote: Words are, like wines.
author: Santosh Kalwar,  You Can

quote: Words save our lives, sometimes.
author: Neil Gaiman,  The Ocean at the End of the Lane

quote: That's not a bad word...hate and war are bad words, but fuck isn't.
author: Judy Blume,  Forever

quote: Some people have a way with words, and other people...oh, uh, not have way.
author: Steve Martin

quote: Wordsare powerfulforces of nature.they are destruction.they are nourishment. they are flesh. they are water.they are flowers and bone.they burn. they cleansethey erase. they etch. they can eitherleave youfeelinghomelessor brimmingwith home.
author: Sanober Khan

quote: Words bounce. Words, if you let them, will do what they want to do and what they have to do.
author: Anne Carson,  Autobiography of Red

quote: Words - so innocent and powerless as they are, as standing in a dictionary, how potent for good and evil they become in the hands of one who knows how to combine them.
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

quote: I like using big words. Words like huge, gigantic, massive.
author: Jarod Kintz,  This is the story my great-grandfather told my father, who then told my grandfather, who then told me about how The Mythical Mr. Boo, Charles Manseur Fizzlebush Grissham III, better known as Mr. Fizzlebush, and Orafoura are all in fact me...

quote: Grand. There's a word I really hate. It's a phony. I could puke every time I hear it.
author: J.D. Salinger,  The Catcher in the Rye

quote: Words, too, have genuine substance -- mass and weight and specific gravity.
author: Tim O'Brien,  Tomcat In Love

quote: Don't gobblefunk around with words.
author: Roald Dahl,  The BFG

quote: All words are masks and the lovelier they are, the more they are meant to conceal.
author: Steven Millhauser

quote: A written word is the choicest of relics. It is something at once more intimate with us and more universal than any other work of art. It is the work of art nearest to life itself. It may be translated into every language, and not only be read but actually breathed from all human lips; -- not be represented on canvas or in marble only, but be carved out of the breath of life itself.
author: Henry David Thoreau,  Walden

quote: Old words are reborn with new faces.
author: Criss Jami,  Killosophy

quote: ...if you do not even understand what words say,how can you expect to pass judgementon what words conceal?
author: H.D.,  Trilogy: The Walls Do Not Fall / Tribute to the Angels / The Flowering of the Rod

quote: impossible is not a word
author: Obert Skye,  Leven Thumps and the Gateway to Foo

quote: Words are, of course, the most powerful drug used by mankind.
author: Rudyard Kipling

quote: When will you learn that there isn't a word for everything?
author: Nicole Krauss,  The History of Love

quote: The best of us must sometimes eat our words.
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: Strong words outlast the paper they are written upon.
author: Joseph Bruchac,  Code Talker: A Novel About the Navajo Marines of World War Two

quote: Every word first looks around in every direction before letting itself be written down by me.
author: Franz Kafka

quote: For wordsmiths and masters of words, without necessarily being harsh with words, the words have a tendency to shoot straight to the hearts of people, and this either deeply touches them or deeply angers them. Like the apostles in all their loving controversies are those who are masters of words while combining this gift with truth.
author: Criss Jami,  Killosophy

quote: All words are pegs to hang ideas on.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Words are pale shadows of forgotten names. As names have power, words have power. Words can light fires in the minds of men. Words can wring tears from the hardest hearts.
author: Patrick Rothfuss,  The Name of the Wind

quote: Words are directed to your personalities namely; - God, your hearers, devil and yourself.
author: Jaachynma N.E. Agu,  The Prince and the Pauper

quote: Spelling Bees are useless and unnecessary competitions. Before Microsoft Word and Google, Spelling Bees had value, but now they are all superflewus.
author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

quote: We live and breathe words.
author: Cassandra Clare,  Clockwork Prince

quote: Writer speaks a stench.
author: Franz Kafka

quote: Books are easily destroyed. But words will live as long as people can remember them.
author: Tahereh Mafi,  Unravel Me

quote: Everything depends on One Word : "Maktub"!
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: Words dazzle and deceive because they are mimed by the face. But black words on a white page are the soul laid bare.
author: Guy de Maupassant

quote: It's the word 'artful'; it's such a great word, with its dark and its light side, its art and its cunning, the craft and the crafty of it - I've been preoccupied with the word 'artful' and the twin notions of 'cornucopia' and 'pickpocket' it suggests for quite some time.
author: Ali Smith

quote: Having Words with Words [10w] ”I’ve had a falling out with words,leaving me speechless.
author: Beryl Dov
